info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:35PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A series of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Granite and south central Powell Counties along Interstate 90 through 615 PM MDT... At 533 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Garrison, or 10 miles southeast of Drummond, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain and small hail will cause reductions in visibility. Locations impacted include... Garrison, Jens, Brock Creek, and Goldcreek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 159 and 177. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
